triples.name: Political polarization
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the phenomenon of political polarization and explains its mechanisms through digital media interactions.

triples.name: Affective polarization
triples.relevance: The paper draws on affective polarization literature to understand emotional dislike and distrust between political groups as distinct from ideological polarization.

triples.name: Partisan sorting
triples.relevance: The paper proposes that partisan sorting—the alignment of conflicting identities along party lines—is the key mechanism driving polarization.

triples.name: Echo chamber (media)
triples.relevance: The paper critiques the echo chamber hypothesis and uses it as a starting point to develop an alternative causal mechanism.

triples.name: Digital media
triples.relevance: The paper examines how digital media platforms facilitate nonlocal interactions that drive partisan alignment and polarization.

triples.name: Opinion dynamics
triples.relevance: The paper draws on opinion dynamics research to model how individual-level opinion convergence can lead to population-level polarization.
